snippet: In an era when the United States has had an average of one mass shooting or more every day, the country has become the land of the free and the brave, and the home of the futile gesture.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines response of New Jersey Gov Chris Christie to mass shootings, like one in San Bernardino, Calif; says thoughts and prayers are actions of reasonable person, but questions Christie's decision as a public official and presidential hopeful to also veto sensible gun control laws.
lead_paragraph: In an era when the United States has had an average of one mass shooting or more every day, the country has become the land of the free and the brave, and the home of the futile gesture.

headline.print_headline: Wanting More Than a Veto and a Prayer
headline.main: Wanting More Than a Veto and a Prayer After Mass Shootings
